title: Multimodal Meaning-Making Learning Design in Science Classrooms

context.prior_knowledge: Requirement of intermediate theoretical background and practical experience
context.additional_context: Enhancing multimodal representation skills necessary for learners with diverse linguistic backgrounds to engage with scientific content.

learning_goals: Utilize diverse symbolic systems—such as models, diagrams, and symbols—to explain scientific phenomena.

Learners apply the scientific discourse structure (problem statement-hypothesis-method-results-discussion) when writing social science research papers, producing a 1,500-character oral presentation and a 3,000-character written report. In report evaluations, they achieve ≥80% scores on a rubric comprising research logic (30%), evidence presentation (30%), and academic expression (40%).
Learners can analyze the grammatical structure and semantic relationships of scientific terminology to explain conceptual interconnections.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
